Dimensions & Placement : â€¢ The circular burst is approximately the same height as the text "Ameren". â€¢ "ILLINOIS" is centered directly beneath "Ameren". Analysis : â€¢ The use of green and the burst motif may suggest energy, growth, or sustainability, aligning with Ameren Illinoisâ€™s identity as a utility company. â€¢ The red segment adds visual emphasis and may represent a spark or focus point. - ![Facebook icon] inline micro-figure - ![Twitter icon] inline micro-figure - **AmerenIllinois.com** Customer Service 1.800.232.2477 Statement Issued: 05/24/2022 Amount Due: $1,104.68 Due Date: Jun 7, 2022 Account Number: 3708154045 Customer Name: MIDSTATE MANUFACTURING Service Address: 1020 S HENDERSON ST OFC GALESBURG, IL 61401 Last Payment $755.64 *Payment received. ![inline icon: white circle with green 'i' information symbol] Important Account Messages Summary : This bar chart presents the monthly electric usage history in kilowatt hours (kWh) alongside the average monthly temperature (Â°F) for a one-year period, allowing comparison of energy consumption with seasonal temperature changes. bar chart: # Title & Axes : â€¢ Title: "Electric Usage History in Kilowatt Hours (kWh)" â€¢ X-axis: Months (from May to the following May), each labeled with the month and average monthly temperature in Â°F. â€¢ Y-axis: Electric usage in kilowatt hours (kWh), with values shown above each bar. # Data Points : â€¢ May (58Â°): 3456 kWh â€¢ June (72Â°): 5376 kWh â€¢ July (74Â°): 5376 kWh â€¢ August (76Â°): 5376 kWh â€¢ September (75Â°): 3840 kWh â€¢ October (66Â°): 3072 kWh â€¢ November (47Â°): 4992 kWh â€¢ December (39Â°): 5376 kWh â€¢ January (29Â°): 7680 kWh â€¢ February (24Â°): 7296 kWh â€¢ March (39Â°): 6528 kWh â€¢ April (44Â°): 6144 kWh â€¢ May (63Â°): 9216 kWh # Design Encodings : â€¢ Bars are light blue, with the final May bar in a darker blue. â€¢ Each bar is labeled with its exact kWh value above it. â€¢ Average monthly temperature is shown below each month as a small blue dot with the temperature in Â°F. # Distribution & Trends : â€¢ Electric usage is relatively low in May, rises in summer (Juneâ€“August), dips in early fall (Septemberâ€“October), increases again in winter (Novemberâ€“March), and peaks sharply in the final May. â€¢ The lowest usage is in October (3072 kWh), and the highest is in the final May (9216 kWh). â€¢ There is a general pattern of higher usage during both the hottest and coldest months. # Analysis : â€¢ Electric usage tends to increase during periods of extreme temperatures (summer and winter), likely due to heating and cooling demands. â€¢ The sharp spike in the final May (9216 kWh) is an outlier compared to the rest of the year. â€¢ Usage is lowest during mild months (October, May at 58Â°), suggesting less need for climate control. â€¢ The pattern suggests a strong correlation between temperature extremes and higher electricity consumption.
TIME PERIOD AVG. DAILY USE
CURRENT MONTH 297.29 kWh
LAST MONTH 204.80 kWh
LAST YEAR 119.17 kWh
Summary : This image is an advertisement promoting the use of automatic payment (Auto Pay) for Ameren Illinois utility bills, highlighting the benefit of avoiding late fees and the convenience of the service. illustration: Scene Overview : â€¢ The main subject is a promotional banner for Ameren Illinois Auto Pay. â€¢ Left side features bold text: "Never see another late fee with AUTO PAY!" with "AUTO PAY!" in large green font. â€¢ Below the text is an illustration of a calendar marked "2022" with a green checkmark overlay. â€¢ Right side contains a blue box with white text: "It's a convenient way to save time and energy." â€¢ Below, in black and green text: "Enroll at AmerenIllinois.com/AutoPay". â€¢ A QR code is present on the far right for quick access to the enrollment page. Technical Details : â€¢ No scale bar, magnification, or scientific annotation. â€¢ The calendar icon and checkmark are stylized, not functional. â€¢ The QR code is square, black-and-white, and visually standard. Spatial Relationships : â€¢ Text and icons are arranged horizontally, with the call-to-action and QR code on the right, and the main message and calendar on the left. â€¢ The green color is used for emphasis on "AUTO PAY!" and the checkmark, reinforcing the positive message. Analysis : â€¢ The visual design uses green to signal reliability and positive outcomes (no late fees). â€¢ The QR code and website link provide immediate action steps, making the ad interactive and actionable. â€¢ The calendar and checkmark icon visually reinforce the concept of timely, automatic payments. Summary : This image is a small, square, high-contrast black-and-white pattern composed of a grid of filled and empty squares, characteristic of a 2D barcode. barcode: Type & Structure : â€¢ Barcode type: DataMatrix (square, grid-based, no visible numeric or alphanumeric string). â€¢ Approximate module count: 14 Ã— 14 modules (squares). â€¢ Quiet zone: 1 module wide on all sides (white border). Design Features : â€¢ Solid black L-shaped finder pattern on the top and left edges. â€¢ Alternating black and white timing pattern on the bottom and right edges. â€¢ Interior modules arranged in a seemingly random pattern of black and white squares. â€¢ No visible human-readable text or numbers. Dimensions & Placement : â€¢ Shape: perfect square. â€¢ High contrast, suitable for machine reading. Analysis : â€¢ This is a standard DataMatrix barcode, typically used for encoding short strings of data (e.g., serial numbers, IDs) in a compact, machine-readable format. No human-readable information is present in this crop. - [figure: green tag icon] See page 2 for account messages and tips from Ameren Illinois. meren Illinois. Keep this portion for your records. Dimensions and Placement : â€¢ The green and red graphic is positioned to the left of the text. â€¢ "Ameren" is the primary, most prominent text, with "ILLINOIS" directly underneath in a smaller size. Analysis : â€¢ The use of green in the graphic may suggest an association with energy, sustainability, or environmental themes. â€¢ The red segment adds visual emphasis and contrast, possibly indicating a focal point or dynamic energy. â€¢ The overall design is clean and modern, suitable for a utility or energy company. Summary : This image shows two social media icons, representing Facebook and Twitter, in a simple, monochrome style. logo: Scene Overview : â€¢ The image contains two distinct icons: the Facebook "f" logo on the left and the Twitter bird silhouette on the right. â€¢ Both icons are rendered in a solid gray color. â€¢ The background is plain white, with no additional text or graphical elements. Analysis : â€¢ The use of gray color and minimal design suggests these icons are intended as neutral, possibly inactive, social media links or buttons. Analysis : â€¢ The infographic provides a clear, multi-channel overview of payment options, making it easy for customers to choose their preferred method. The use of icons and concise text enhances accessibility and quick comprehension. logo: Ameren Illinois â€¢ The image is a logo featuring the company name "Ameren" in bold black letters, with "ILLINOIS" in smaller, gray, uppercase letters below it. â€¢ To the left of the text is a circular, stylized graphic composed of green radial lines and a single red segment, suggesting motion or energy. â€¢ The overall layout is horizontal, with the graphic on the left and the text on the right. â€¢ The background is white, and there are no additional taglines or elements. Analysis : â€¢ The use of green and the radiating lines in the logo likely conveys themes of energy, sustainability, and forward movement, while the red accent adds visual emphasis. Technical Details : â€¢ No text, labels, or additional graphical elements are present. â€¢ No scale bar or dimensions are indicated. Spatial Relationships : â€¢ Facebook icon is on the left; Twitter icon is on the right. â€¢ Both icons are of similar size and visual weight. Analysis : â€¢ The image is likely intended to represent links or references to Facebook and Twitter social media platforms, using their recognizable logos in a neutral color scheme. Summary : This bar chart presents the monthly electric usage history in kilowatt hours (kWh) alongside the average monthly temperature (Â°F) for a one-year period, allowing comparison of energy consumption with seasonal temperature changes.

bar chart:

# Title & Axes :
  â€¢ Title: "Electric Usage History in Kilowatt Hours (kWh)"
  â€¢ X-axis: Months (from May to the following May), each labeled with the month and average monthly temperature in Â°F.
  â€¢ Y-axis: Electric usage in kilowatt hours (kWh), with values shown above each bar.

# Data Points :
  â€¢ May (58Â°): 3456 kWh
  â€¢ June (72Â°): 5376 kWh
  â€¢ July (74Â°): 5376 kWh
  â€¢ August (76Â°): 5376 kWh
  â€¢ September (75Â°): 3840 kWh
  â€¢ October (66Â°): 3072 kWh
  â€¢ November (47Â°): 4992 kWh
  â€¢ December (39Â°): 5376 kWh
  â€¢ January (29Â°): 7680 kWh
  â€¢ February (24Â°): 7296 kWh
  â€¢ March (39Â°): 6528 kWh
  â€¢ April (44Â°): 6144 kWh
  â€¢ May (63Â°): 9216 kWh

# Design Encodings :
  â€¢ Bars are light blue, with the final May bar in a darker blue.
  â€¢ Each bar is labeled with its exact kWh value above it.
  â€¢ Average monthly temperature is shown below each month as a small blue dot with the temperature in Â°F.

# Distribution & Trends :
  â€¢ Electric usage is relatively low in May, rises in summer (Juneâ€“August), dips in early fall (Septemberâ€“October), increases again in winter (Novemberâ€“March), and peaks sharply in the final May.
  â€¢ The lowest usage is in October (3072 kWh), and the highest is in the final May (9216 kWh).
  â€¢ There is a general pattern of higher usage during both the hottest and coldest months.

# Analysis :
  â€¢ Electric usage tends to increase during periods of extreme temperatures (summer and winter), likely due to heating and cooling demands.
  â€¢ The sharp spike in the final May (9216 kWh) is an outlier compared to the rest of the year.
  â€¢ Usage is lowest during mild months (October, May at 58Â°), suggesting less need for climate control.
  â€¢ The pattern suggests a strong correlation between temperature extremes and higher electricity consumption.

Summary : This image is an advertisement promoting the use of automatic payment (Auto Pay) for Ameren Illinois utility bills, highlighting the benefit of avoiding late fees and the convenience of the service.

illustration:
Scene Overview :
  â€¢ The main subject is a promotional banner for Ameren Illinois Auto Pay.
  â€¢ Left side features bold text: "Never see another late fee with AUTO PAY!" with "AUTO PAY!" in large green font.
  â€¢ Below the text is an illustration of a calendar marked "2022" with a green checkmark overlay.
  â€¢ Right side contains a blue box with white text: "It's a convenient way to save time and energy."
  â€¢ Below, in black and green text: "Enroll at AmerenIllinois.com/AutoPay".
  â€¢ A QR code is present on the far right for quick access to the enrollment page.
Technical Details :
  â€¢ No scale bar, magnification, or scientific annotation.
  â€¢ The calendar icon and checkmark are stylized, not functional.
  â€¢ The QR code is square, black-and-white, and visually standard.
Spatial Relationships :
  â€¢ Text and icons are arranged horizontally, with the call-to-action and QR code on the right, and the main message and calendar on the left.
  â€¢ The green color is used for emphasis on "AUTO PAY!" and the checkmark, reinforcing the positive message.
Analysis :
  â€¢ The visual design uses green to signal reliability and positive outcomes (no late fees).
  â€¢ The QR code and website link provide immediate action steps, making the ad interactive and actionable.
  â€¢ The calendar and checkmark icon visually reinforce the concept of timely, automatic payments.

Summary : This image is a small, square, high-contrast black-and-white pattern composed of a grid of filled and empty squares, characteristic of a 2D barcode.

barcode:  
Type & Structure :  
  â€¢ Barcode type: DataMatrix (square, grid-based, no visible numeric or alphanumeric string).  
  â€¢ Approximate module count: 14 Ã— 14 modules (squares).  
  â€¢ Quiet zone: 1 module wide on all sides (white border).  

Design Features :  
  â€¢ Solid black L-shaped finder pattern on the top and left edges.  
  â€¢ Alternating black and white timing pattern on the bottom and right edges.  
  â€¢ Interior modules arranged in a seemingly random pattern of black and white squares.  
  â€¢ No visible human-readable text or numbers.  

Dimensions & Placement :  
  â€¢ Shape: perfect square.  
  â€¢ High contrast, suitable for machine reading.  

Analysis :  
  â€¢ This is a standard DataMatrix barcode, typically used for encoding short strings of data (e.g., serial numbers, IDs) in a compact, machine-readable format. No human-readable information is present in this crop.

Summary : This image lists the available payment methods for Ameren Illinois customers, including online, phone, mail, and in-person options, with brief instructions and contact details.

infographic:
# Payment Methods :
  â€¢ ONLINE E-CHECK: Pay online using an electronic check.
  â€¢ ONLINE CREDIT CARD: Pay online using a credit card.
  â€¢ PHONE: Pay by calling 888.777.3108.
  â€¢ MAIL: Pay by mailing a stub and check.
  â€¢ IN PERSON: Find a pay station at amerenillinois.com/paystation.

# Icons & Layout :
  â€¢ Each payment method is paired with a relevant icon (e.g., check, credit card, phone, envelope, person).
  â€¢ Methods are grouped in two rows, with text and icons aligned for clarity.

# Text Details :
  â€¢ All payment methods are labeled in bold uppercase, with a short description or instruction below.
